intro: Phyllostachys angusta, commonly known as the narrow bamboo, is a species native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are linear and often have a glossy appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Phyllostachys angusta is valued in horticulture for its elegant form and adaptability to various garden settings.
